title: Sales Force Account

sf:phone.title: Phone
sf:phone.description: Primary phone number of account. Up to 40 characters are allowed in this field.

sf:legalName.title: Account Name
sf:legalName.description: name of company. Up to 255 characters are allowed in this field.

sf:accountNumber.title: Account Number
sf:accountNumber.description: Tracking or reference number for account. Up to 40 characters are allowed in this field.

sf:accountRecordType.title: Account Record Type
sf:accountRecordType.description: Name of the field that determines what picklist values are available for the record. Available in professional, enterprise, unlimited, performance, and developer editions.

sf:accountSource.title: Account Source
sf:accountSource.description: The source of the account record. For example, advertisement, data.com, or trade show. The source is selected from a picklist of available values, which a salesforce admin sets. Each picklist value can have up to 40 characters.

sf:cleanStatus.title: Clean Status
sf:cleanStatus.description: The record’s clean status, as compared with data.com. Values are not compared, in sync, reviewed, different, not found, and inactive. This field is available if you use data.com prospector or data.com clean.

sf:createdById.title: Created By
sf:createdById.description: User who created the account, including creation date and time. (Read only)

sf:customLinks.title: Custom Links
sf:customLinks.description: listing of custom links for accounts as set up by your salesforce admin.

sf:masterRecordId.title: Account
sf:masterRecordId.description: master record id of the account

sf:modifiedBy.title: Modified By
sf:modifiedBy.description: user who last changed the account fields, including modification date and time. This field doesn’t track changes made to any of the related list items on the account. (Read only)

sf:ownerId.title: Account Owner
sf:ownerId.description: assigned owner of account. Not available in personal edition.

sf:parentId.title: Parent Account
sf:parentId.description: Parent company for companies that are subsidiaries of a larger company or organization. The parent account must be an existing account in salesforce. You can enter the account name, or select (or optionally, create) the account using the lookup icon.

sf:partnerAccountId.title: Partner Account
sf:partnerAccountId.description: Read-only field that indicates whether an account is a partner account.

sf:site.title: Account Site
sf:site.description: information about the account’s location, such as single location, headquarters, or branch. Up to 80 characters are allowed in this field.

sf:territory.title: Tradestyle
sf:territory.description: a name, different from its legal name, that a company can use for conducting business. Similar to “doing business as” or “dba”. This field is available if you use data.com prospector or data.com clean.

sf:territoryId.title: Territories
sf:territoryId.description: The territories to which the account has been assigned.

sf:tickerSymbol.title: Ticker Symbol
sf:tickerSymbol.description: The abbreviation used to identify publicly traded shares of a particular stock. Also known as the stock symbol. Up to 20 characters are allowed in this field.

sf:yearStarted.title: Year Started
sf:yearStarted.description: The year the company was established or the year when current ownership or management assumed control of the company. If the company establishment or ownership year is unavailable, then the year the dun & bradstreet record was created will be used. Dun & bradstreet does not supply this data for branch locations.this field is available if you use data.com prospector or data.com clean.

sf:jigsaw.title: Data.com Key
sf:jigsaw.description: The company’s id in data.com. When salesforce records are compared with data.com records (via manual cleaning or automated clean jobs), if data.com finds a match, the two records are linked by this field’s numeric value.

sf:legalNameLocal.title: Account Name (Local)
sf:legalNameLocal.description: The name of the account translated into the local language.

sf:NAICSDescription.title: NAICS Description
sf:NAICSDescription.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on its naics code. This field is available if you use data.com prospector or data.com clean.

sf:sicDesc.title: SIC Description
sf:sicDesc.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on its sic code.

sf:type.title: Account Type
sf:type.description: Type of account, for example, customer, competitor, or partner. Entry is selected from a picklist of available values, which a salesforce admin sets. Each picklist value can have up to 40 characters.

sf:DUNSNumber.title: D-U-N-S Number
sf:DUNSNumber.description: The data universal numbering system (d-u-n-s) number is a unique nine-digit number assigned to every business location in the d&b database that has a unique, separate, and distinct operation. D-u-n-s numbers are used by industries and organizations around the world as a global standard for business identification and tracking. This field is available if you use data.com prospector or data.com clean.
